DOC.brief_summary: This study compare two FDA approve Cataract Lasers .
DOC.brief_title: The Comparison Cataract Lasers Using Optimedica Catalys Laser Alcon LenSx Laser .
DOC.detailed_description: The purpose study systematically evaluate performance two commercially available FDA clear femtosecond laser system patient undergoing femtosecond laser-assisted cataract surgery . Objective data repeatability accuracy study parameter gather report endpoint study . The two system study Catalys™ Precision Laser System ( OptiMedica , CA , USA ) LenSx® Laser System ( Alcon Laboratories , Inc. , Fort Worth , TX ) . Published data suggest femtosecond laser useful tool cataract surgery . This study determine whether difference similarity exist specific treatment parameter achieve two FDA clear commercially available femtosecond laser cataract surgery platform
DOC.criteria: Have grade 2 4 nuclear sclerotic cortical posterior subcapsular cataract visual impairment . Pupillary dilation least 6.0 mm Axial length 21 mm 26 mm Age ≥ 22 year either gender Require laser assist corneal incision , capsulotomy nucleus segmentation Understand sign write Informed Consent form Be able comply treatment followup schedule Enrolment another drug device study within prior 3 month History ocular trauma Acute chronic disease illness would increase risk confound study result ( e.g. , uncontrolled diabetes mellitus , immunocompromised , etc . ) Uncontrolled systemic ocular disease Corneal abnormality ( e.g. , stromal , epithelial endothelial dystrophy , severe corneal opacity , significant corneal edema , etc ) Diminished aqueous clarity obscure OCT image anterior lens capsule Corneal ring and/or inlay implant ( ) Pseudoexfoliation Known steroid IOP responder ocular hypertension IOP > 25 mmHg tonometry Retinal detachment within last 6 month Anterior chamber depth le 2.5 mm
